clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Life and Patient-centered Outcomes After Hospitalization for COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Health-related Quality of Life and Patient-centered Outcomes After Hospitalization for COVID-19: A Multicenter Prospective Cohort Study

collaborator.agency: Brazilian Research In Intensive Care Network

brief_summary.textblock: The present study aims to assess the determinants of health-related quality of life and patient-centered long-term outcomes among survivors of hospitalization for Covid-19 in Brazil. The investigators will conduct a multicenter prospective cohort study nested in randomized clinical trials (coalition Covid-19 Brazil initiative) originally designed to assess the effects of specific Covid-19 treatments. Adult survivors of hospitalization due to proven or suspected SARS-CoV-2 infection will be followed up for a period of one year by means of structured telephone interviews. The primary outcome is one-year health-related quality of life assessed by the EQ-5D-3L. Secondary outcomes include all-cause mortality, rehospitalizations, return to work or study, physical functional status assessed by the Lawton & Brody Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale, dyspnea assessed by the modified medical research council dyspnea scale, need of long-term ventilatory support, symptoms of anxiety and depression assessed by the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder assessed by the Impact of Event Scale-revised. Four sets of variables (1-demographic characteristics, 2-pre-morbid state of health, 3-characteristics of acute illness, and 4- specific Covid-19 treatments received) will be assessed as potential risk factors for health-related quality of life and secondary outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: One-year utility score of health-related quality of life
primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed 12 months after enrollment.
primary_outcome.description: The outcome will be assessed using the Brazilian version of the Euroqol-5D-3L (EQ-5D3L) questionnaire. The utility score derived from the EQ5D-3L ranges from 0 (death) to 1 (perfect health).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed 3, 6, 9 and 12 months after enrollment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of return to work or study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed 3, 6, 9 and 12 months after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of return to work or study among patients that were working or studying at the moment of hospitalization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Score of Instrumental Activities of Daily Living
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed 3, 6, 9 and 12 months after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome will be assessed using the Lawton & Brody Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale (the score ranges from 0 to 8, with higher scores indicating less dependence).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed 3, 6, 9, and 12 months after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome will be assessed using the modified medical research council dyspnea scale. Scores ranges from 0 to 4, with higher scores indicating worse symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of long-term ventilatory support need
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed 3, 6, 9 and 12 months after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients requiring oxygen therapy, non-invasive ventilation, or mechanical ventilation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed 3, 6, 9 and 12 months after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome will be assessed using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (anxiety and depression scores range from 0 to 21, with higher scores indicating worse symptoms).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed 3, 6, 9 and 12 months after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome will be assessed using the Impact Event Scale-Revised (the score ranges from 0 to 88, with higher scores indicating worse symptoms).

secondary_outcome.measure: Utility score of health-related quality of life at 3, 6, and 9 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed 3, 6, and 9 months after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome will be assessed using the Brazilian version of the Euroqol-5D-3L (EQ-5D3L) questionnaire. The utility score derived from the EQ5D-3L ranges from 0 (death) to 1 (perfect health).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed 3, 6, 9, and 12 months after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome will be assessed using the visual analogue scale of the Brazilian version of the Euroqol-5D-3L questionnaire (EQ-VAS; score range from o to 100, with higher scores indicating better self-rated health).

arm_group.description: Adult hospitalized patients with proven or suspected SARS-Cov-2 infection with up to 4L/minute oxygen supply through nasal catheter.
Adult hospitalized patients with proven or suspected SARS-Cov-2 infection needing oxygen supplementation > 4L/min on nasal catheter or HFNC or NIV or MV or ECMO.
Adult hospitalized patients with proven or suspected SARS-Cov-2 infection with moderate or severe ARDS according to the Berlin definition

study_pop.textblock: Adult survivors of hospitalization due to proven or suspected SARS-CoV-2 infection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18 years and older
- Hospitalization due to proven or suspected SARS-CoV-2 infection
- Meeting eligibility criteria for Coalition Covid-19 Brazil randomized clinical trials
Exclusion Criteria:
- Death during the hospitalization
- Absence of telephone contact
- Absence of proxy for patients with communication difficulties
- Refusal or withdrawal of agreement to participate
